snippet: The central bank president, Mario Draghi, was interrupted in his remarks by a protester who tossed confetti and yelled “end E.C.B. dictatorship.”
abstract: European Central Bank president Mario Draghi says in news conference that bond-buying stimulus program along with low oil prices and improved government policies are benefiting eurozone economy; protester interrupts conference to throw confetti at Draghi before being subdued by security guards.
lead_paragraph: The central bank president, Mario Draghi, was interrupted in his remarks by a protester who tossed confetti and yelled “end E.C.B. dictatorship.”

headline.main: E.C.B. Sees Early Progress From Its Bond-Buying Program
headline.print_headline: E.C.B. Sees Early Progress From Its Stimulus Effort
